text:
SECTION: 2019 Runner Up (S2) Question 1 Assumption
CONTEXT: Spread of nicotine vaping (SIRS).
CONTENT: The SIRS model assumes a **closed population** (no migration in or out). It assumes that the **recovery probability** (quitting the substance) and the **loss of immunity probability** (relapse) are **constant rates** over time.

metadata.question: Q1
metadata.topic: SIRS Model, Constant Rates, Closed System

text:
SECTION: 2019 Runner Up (S2) Question 1 Model
CONTEXT: Spread of nicotine vaping.
CONTENT: A Modified SIRS Epidemiology Model (Susceptible-Infected-Recovered-Susceptible) was used. 'Infected' represented addicted users. The model used differential equations to track flow between these states, treating vaping as a contagion.

SECTION: 2019 Runner Up (S2) Question 2 Model
CONTEXT: Probability of student drug use.
CONTENT: A Binary Multivariate Logistic Model was used. It calculated the probability of an individual using a substance based on a weighted sum of demographic factors (race, gender, SES).
